alert.note: Alert for Assumption; Central Plaquemines; Coastal Jefferson; Eastern Ascension; Eastern Orleans; Iberville; Lower Jefferson; Lower Lafourche; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Lower Terrebonne; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Jefferson; Upper Lafourche; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Upper Terrebonne; Western Ascension; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 11:59AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Fire Danger Increasing Across Extreme Southeast LA... After coordination with federal fire weather officials and due to area wide Burn Bans, it is prudent to be extra vigilant tomorrow about the increased fire danger conditions. Given the widespread severe drought conditions currently over much of the region, extreme temperatures, increase in winds around 10 to 20 mph with higher gusts, and Burn Bans across the entire area, fire weather conditions will be favorable for fire to quickly spread. This mainly pertains to areas along and south of I-10 as a Red Flag Warning is in effect for areas to the north. Conditions across southeast Louisiana south of I-10 are every bit as bad as to the north however, there is a chance of a few showers and thunderstorms tomorrow as a passing tropical wave over the Gulf moves to the west. The tropical wave is going to be well to the south but will still lead to increasing winds across the region and could allow for some rain to move across the coast. If rain does not look like it will move inland a Red Flag Warning will likely be needed for these areas. Again conditions are favorable for increasing fire danger conditions tomorrow. Please listen to all local and state officials and refrain from any burning.
